metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16862 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A security flaw was found in the Linux kernel in a way that the cleancachesubsystem clears an inode after the final file truncation (removal). Thenew file created with the same inode may contain leftover pages fromcleancache and the old file data instead of the new one.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-142.168
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-142.168
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-142.168
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1103.111
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1107-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1107.112
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1075.85
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1055.60
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1040.46
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-142.168').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
